summary: Elizabeth Brown Norris was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents detail her employment, annual salary, and gross pay during her time with the committee. The documents do not specify her exact role within the SCA, but her presence on payroll certifications indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Elizabeth Brown Norris's significance lies in her being a staff member of the Select Committee on Assassinations, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination, although her specific role and contributions are not detailed in the provided documents.
